author: P V
text:
A man who had merely passed first standard not only got appointed as a teacher at a panchayat union primary school here but also got promoted as the school’s headmaster allegedly using a fake academic certificate.

Arulsundaram (43) alias Raja has gone missing after his fraudulent academic claims were exposed during an inquiry into a fake certificate racket on Tuesday.

Fake certificates

According to sources, Arulsundaram was working as the headmaster at the Kangojiputhur Panchayat union primary school in Vepanapalli for the past seven years here.

He had discontinued studies after Standard I at the Kadhiripuram Panchayat union primary school in Kaveripattinam in 1978 and joined as a teacher in 2001 using fake credentials in Dharmapuri. In 2009, he was promoted as headmaster and posted at the Kangojiputhur primary school.

Recently, the police had arrested a 37-year-old man Muniappan in Palacode in Dharmapuri on charges of producing forged certificates to join as a teacher 11 years ago.

During questioning, he revealed that he had sourced the certificates from a broker Rajendran of Kaveripattinam here and another ‘teacher’ Senthil Kumar too had obtained certificates from him. The police then arrested Senthil Kumar who was working at a Government school in Vellore. Later, police learnt that Arulsundaram too had obtained forged certificates. “We are looking for him,” a Crime Branch officer said.
title: A headmaster who passed just Standard I
